p: The application of bacteriophages in therapy has been successful in treating: (i) MDR A. baumannii infections ( Schooley et al., 2017); (ii) against Mycobacterial infections ( Dedrick et al., 2019); (iii) burn-wound infections caused by P. aeruginosa ( Jault et al., 2019); (iv) infections caused by S. aureus ( Fabijan et al., 2020); (v) Enterococcal infections ( Khalifa et al., 2016); and (vi) against MDR E. coli infections ( Sarker et al., 2016; Kakasis and Panitsa, 2019). Preparations of phage cocktails, phage banks, phage powders, and phage-derived endolysins as part of phage therapeutic approaches are possible and bring strategies closer to clinical applications ( Manohar et al., 2019b, c).
